intro: Psychotria matagalpensis, commonly known as the Matagalpa Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the cloud forests of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, thriving in the understory of tropical forests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in botanical and pharmacological research.
